column4: hi everybody, where could I find an alternative precompiled kernel for hoary? I have problems with the default one provided in the distribution
or I'll break the system?
what is the problem?
there's no way to activate DMA on ide drives on boot.
only on CDROM...
and this is an expected and wanted behaviour
yes, sorry, on CDROMs, hdds are OK
it's not a bug
it wouldn't be a bug if it woul be possible to activate it via hdparm.conf, but as I edit that file the system randomly hangs on boot.
it is not a bug.. ther reason why it is disabled by default is because DMA on cdrom, breaks on more systems that people can imagine.
I've always used DMA on all linux boxes I had on this system without a single problem
you have been lucky
so, now suppose I happy with a problematic system with dma activated, how can I activate it on boot?
hdparm -c 1 -d 1 /dev/<whatever_cdrom_you_have>
if it hangs at boot like you said, well than you are seeking for troubles playing with DMA :)
you're discouraging me to use ubuntu, man. dma on my system worked _very_ well on all linux systems I've tryed. so this MUST be a bug
file one, and i will close it straigh away.. it's no a bug again...
ubuntu is a choise... nobody forces it to you
I know, I use it because I like it, in warty dma worked without problems
no, it didn't.. it was still disabled by default.
no, it was enabled: hdparm -d /dehdc returned 1
